title: How to Emboss a Stamp Image

steps.headline: Work on a covered surface.
steps.description: It's a good idea to also lay down a square of thick cardboard that can be picked up to allow for easy return of the unused embossing powder.

steps.headline: Select the stamp image you wish to emboss.
steps.description: You'll also need to choose the ink color and get the stamp pad ready.

steps.headline: Set up the embossing powder.
steps.description: Remove the lid from its container and set to one side in readiness for grabbing.

steps.headline: Set the paper, card or other item to be stamped onto a flat surface.
Ink the stamp.
steps.description: Be generous with the amount, although not so much as to cause smudging.

steps.headline: Press the stamp onto the paper or card surface.
Pick up the embossing powder container.
steps.description: Quickly but carefully sprinkle the powder over the surface of the image. The wet ink will cause the embossing powder to stick to the image outline.

steps.headline: Pick up the stamped paper.
steps.description: Gently shake off the excess embossing powder onto the cardboard square. This can be carefully funneled back into the container for reuse.

steps.headline: Use the toaster for one cycle.
steps.description: This is simply to create adequate heat to heat the image.

steps.headline: Heat the embossed stamped image.
steps.description: Hold it over the pre-heated toaster.

steps.headline: Keep it in place until the embossing powder melts.
steps.description: It should form a smooth, unbroken surface following the outline of the image.

steps.headline: Finished.
steps.description: The design is now permanent. It can be used for making cards, in paper craft projects or for display.

Gently shake off the excess embossing powder onto the cardboard square. This can be carefully funneled back into the container for reuse. Setting the embossing Use the toaster for one cycle. This is simply to create adequate heat to heat the image. Heat the embossed stamped image. Hold it over the pre-heated toaster. Keep it in place until the embossing powder melts.
